article.paragraph: TheChrysler Buildingis anArt DecostyleEarly skyscrapersskyscraperlocated on theEast Side (Manhattan)East SideofMidtown ManhattaninNew York City, at the intersection of42nd Street (Manhattan)42nd StreetandLexington Avenue (Manhattan)Lexington Avenuein theTurtle Bay, ManhattanTurtle Bayneighborhood. AtConvert1,046ftm0us,"Map."Turtle Bay, ManhattanTurtle Bay Association. Retrieved January 25, 2009.cite webhttp://skyscraperpage.com/cities/?buildingIDThe Chrysler Building –Skyscraperpage.comSeptember 27, 2010the structure was the world's tallest building for 11 months before it was surpassed by theEmpire State Buildingin 1931.cite webhttp://ctbuh.org/AboutCTBUH/History/MeasuringTall/tabid/1320/language/en-US/Default.aspxThe History of Measuring Tall BuildingsCouncil on Tall Buildings and Urban HabitatMay 1, 2012It is still the tallest brick building in the world, albeit with an internal steel skeleton. After theSeptember 11 attacksdestructionof theWorld Trade Center (1973-2001)World Trade Center, it was again the second-tallest building in New York City until December 2007, when thespirewas raised on the 1,200-foot (365.8 m)Bank of America Tower (New York City)Bank of America Tower, pushing the Chrysler Building into third position. In addition,The New York Times Building, which opened in 2007, is exactly level with the Chrysler Building in height.cite webhttp://www.emporis.com/city/newyorkcity-ny-usaEmporis Data – See Tallest buildings RankingEmporis.comJune 15, 2009September 27, 2010Both buildings were then pushed into 4th position, when the under constructionOne World Trade Centersurpassed their height.

The Chrysler Building is a classic example of Art Deco architecture and considered by many contemporary architects to be#Representationone of the finest buildings in New York City. In 2007, it was ranked ninth on theList of America's Favorite Architecture according to the AIAList of America's Favorite Architectureby theAmerican Institute of Architects.cite webhttp://favoritearchitecture.org/afa150.phpFavoriteArchitecture.orgFavoriteArchitecture.orgSeptember 27, 2010It was the headquarters of theChryslerChrysler Corporationfrom 1930 until the mid-1950s. Although the building was built and designed specifically for the car manufacturer, the corporation did not pay for the construction of it and never owned it, asWalter P. Chryslerdecided to pay for it himself, so that his children could inherit it.cite newsThe Silver Spire: How two men's dreams changed the skyline of New YorkClaudia RothPierponthttp://www.jayebee.com/discoveries/criticism/silver_spire.htmThe New YorkerNovember 18, 2002October 23, 2011

article.paragraph: The Chrysler Building was designed by architectWilliam Van Alenfor a project ofWalter P. Chrysler.When the ground breaking occurred on September 19, 1928, there was an intense competition in New York City to build the world's tallest skyscraper.cite webEmporis GmbHhttp://www.emporis.com/building/the-trump-building-new-york-city-ny-usaEmporis Data "...a celebrated three-way race to become the tallest building in the world."Emporis.comSeptember 27, 2010cite webhttp://www.skyscraper.org/TALLEST_TOWERS/t_manco.htmThe Manhattan Company – Skyscraper.org; "...'race' to erect the tallest tower in the world."Skyscraper.orgSeptember 27, 2010Despite a frantic pace (the building was built at an average rate of four floors per week), no workers died during the construction of this skyscraper.
article.heading: Design beginnings
article.paragraph: Van Alen's original design for the skyscraper called for a decorative jewel-like glass crown. It also featured a base in which the showroom windows were tripled in height and topped by 12 stories with glass-wrapped corners, creating an impression that the tower appeared physically and visually light as if floating in mid-air.The height of the skyscraper was also originally designed to beConvert246mft0us.University of WisconsinMadison; School of Engineering The Chrysler Buildingwaybackhttp://ecow.engr.wisc.edu/cgi-bin/getbig/cee/340/davidcamac/studentsbu/chryslerbuilding.ppt20140709013602However, the design proved to be too advanced and costly for building contractor William H. Reynolds, who disapproved of Van Alen's original plan.cite webEmporis GmbHhttp://www.emporis.com/building/chryslerbuilding-newyorkcity-ny-usa– Chrysler BuildingEmporis.comSeptember 27, 2010The design and lease were then sold toWalter P. Chrysler, who worked with Van Alen and redesigned the skyscraper for additional stories; it was eventually revised to beConvert282mft0ontall.As Walter Chrysler was the chairman of the Chrysler Corporation and intended to make the building into Chrysler's headquarters,various architectural details and especially the building's gargoyles were modeled after Chrysler automobile products like the hood ornaments of the Plymouth; they exemplify the machine age in the 1920s (Chrysler Building#Architecturesee below).cite webChrysler Buildinghttp://glasssteelandstone.com/BuildingDetail.php?IDglasssteelandstone.comOctober 11, 2008Emporis Data
article.heading: Construction
article.paragraph: Construction commenced on September 19, 1928.In total, almost 400,000 rivets were usedand approximately 3,826,000 bricks were manually laid, to create the non-loadbearing walls of the skyscraper.#StravitzStravitz 2002, Pages 54, 158, image caption no.39Contractors, builders and engineers were joined by other building-services experts to coordinate construction.

Prior to its completion, the building stood about even with a rival project at40 Wall Street, designed byH. Craig Severance. Severance increased the height of his project and then publicly claimed the title of the world's tallest building.Emporis Data See source no.4 line 4; "Briefly held the world's tallest title until it was eclipsed by the spire of Chrysler Building."(This distinction excluded structures that were not fully habitable, such as theEiffel Tower.)CTBUH Criteria of World's Tallest BuildingIn response, Van Alen obtained permission for aConvert38mft0onuslong spire#StravitzStravitz 2002, Page 161. Image caption no.39and had it secretly constructed inside the frame of the building. The spire was delivered to the site in four different sections.#StravitzStravitz 2002, Page 161, image caption no.54On October 23, 1929, the bottom section of the spire was hoisted onto the top of the building's dome and lowered into the 66th floor of the building. The other remaining sections of the spire were hoisted and riveted to the first one in sequential order in just 90 minutes.#StravitzStravitz 2002, Pages xiii (Paragraph 10) and 161. Image caption no.39
article.heading: Completion
article.paragraph: Upon completion, May 20, 1930,the added height of the spire allowed the Chrysler Building to surpass40 Wall Streetas the tallest building in the world and the Eiffel Tower as the tallest structure. It was the first man-made structure to stand taller thanConvert1000ftm0. Van Alen's satisfaction in these accomplishments was likely muted byWalter Chrysler's later refusal to pay the balance of his architectural fee.Less than a year after it opened to the public on May 27, 1930, the Chrysler Building was surpassed in height by theEmpire State Building, but the Chrysler Building is still the world's tallest steel-supported brick building. As of November 2, 2011, the building's height was surpassed by the under constructionOne World Trade Centerat the height of 1,106 feet.cite webhttp://www.skyscraperpicture.com/chryslerbuilding.htmThe World's Tallest Brick Building – SkyscraperPicture.comwebcache.googleusercontent.comSeptember 27, 2010yeshttps://web.archive.org/20090925002354/http://www.skyscraperpicture.com:80/chryslerbuilding.htm25 September 2009cite webhttp://www.tqnyc.com/NYC062905/chrysler_index.htmlhttp://web.archive.org/web/20070630151437/http://www.tqnyc.com/NYC062905/chrysler_index.html2007-06-30A view from Above – The Chrysler Buildingwebcache.googleusercontent.comSeptember 27, 2010dead linkApril 2012
article.heading: Property
article.paragraph: File:NY Height Comparison.pngthumb250pxleftHeight comparison of buildings in New York CityThe east building wall of the base out of which the tower rises runs at a slant to the Manhattan street grid, following a property line that predated theCommissioners' Plan of 1811.Noted in Kevin Walsh,Forgotten New York: The Ultimate Urban Explorer's Guide to All Five Boroughs, 2006:171.The land on which the Chrysler Building stands was donated toCooper UnionThe Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Artcite webhttp://www.cooper.edu/cubuilds/news_20040818.htmlCooper Union and Chrysler BuildingCooper.eduSeptember 15, 2004September 27, 2010http://web.archive.org/web/20100708221034/http://www.cooper.edu/cubuilds/news_20040818.htmlJuly 8, 2010in 1902. The land was originally leased to William H. Reynolds, but, when he was unable to raise money for the project, the building and the development rights to the land were acquired by Walter P. Chrysler in 1928.cite newsSmart Land Deals as a Cornerstone of Free TuitionAlisonGregorhttp://www.nytimes.com/2008/02/13/business/13cooper.htmlThe New York TimesFebruary 13, 2008October 23, 2010Contrary to popular belief, the Chrysler Corporation was never involved in the construction or ownership of the Chrysler Building, although it was built and designed for the corporation and served as its headquarters until the mid-1950s. It was a project of Walter P. Chrysler for his children.

The ownership of the building has changed several times. The Chrysler family sold the building in 1953 toWilliam Zeckendorf,cite newsA New Owner To Take Over An Old ClassicCharles V.Baglihttp://www.nytimes.com/2000/03/19/nyregion/fyi-304220.htmlThe New York TimesNovember 25, 1997October 26, 2011and in 1957 it was purchased bySol Goldmanand Alex DiLorenzo, and owned byMassachusetts Mutual Life Insurance Company. The lobby was refurbished and the facade renovated in 19781979.cite newsAn enduring hood ornamentMichael J.Lewishttp://www.signonsandiego.com/uniontrib/20050619/news_mz1h19chrysl.htmlhttp://web.archive.org/web/20090519000926/http://www.signonsandiego.com/uniontrib/20050619/news_mz1h19chrysl.htmlMay 19, 2009U-T San DiegoJune 19, 2005October 23, 2011The building was owned byJack Kent Cookein 1979. The spire underwent a restoration that was completed in 1995. In 1998,Tishman Speyer Propertiesand theThe Travelers CompaniesTravelers Insurance Groupbought the Chrysler Building and the adjoining Kent Building in 1997 for about $220 million (equal to $InflationUS2201997-1million in #expr:) from a consortium of banks and the estate of Jack Kent Cooke. Tishman Speyer Properties had negotiated a 150-year lease on the land fromCooper Unionand the college continues to own both the land under the Chrysler Building and the building itself. Cooper Union's name is on the deed.

In 2001, a 75% stake in the building management contract was sold, for US$300 million (equal to $InflationUS3002001-1million in #expr:), to TMW, the German arm of anAtlanta-based investment fund.cite newshttp://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?resGerman Group Buys Stake In SkyscraperThe New York TimesCharles V.BagliMarch 5, 2001April 30, 2010On June 11, 2008 it was reported that theAbu DhabiInvestment Council was in negotiations to buy TMW's 75% economic interest, and a 15% interest from Tishman Speyer Properties in the building, and a share of the Trylons retail structure next door for US$800 million.cite newshttp://www.nypost.com/seven/06112008/business/chrysler_bldg__on_the_block_115016.htmlCHRYSLER BUILDING ON THE BLOCK – SOVEREIGN ARAB FUND TO PAY $800Myeshttps://web.archive.org/20150504170201/http://www.nypost.com/seven/06112008/business/chrysler_bldg__on_the_block_115016.html4 May 2015On July 9, 2008 it was announced that the transaction had been completed, and that theAbu Dhabi Investment Councilwas now the 90% owner of the building.cite newsCharles V. Bagli July 10, 2008 http://www.nytimes.com/2008/07/10/nyregion/10chrysler.html Abu Dhabi Buys 90% Stake in Chrysler Building The New York Times June 8, 2009cite newshttp://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pidNew York's Chrysler Building Bought by Abu Dhabi FundBloombergyeshttps://web.archive.org/20121025172006/http://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid25 October 2012
article.heading: Architecture

link.part: Detail of the Art Deco ornamentation at the crown

article.paragraph: The Chrysler Building is considered a leading example ofArt Decoarchitecture. The corners of the 61st floor are graced with eagles; on the 31st floor, the corner ornamentation are replicas of the 1929 Chryslerhood ornamentradiator caps.cite webhttp://www.imperialclub.com/Yr/1926/building/Cap.htm1926 Chrysler Radiator Cap Used On The Chrysler BuildingImperialclub.comDecember 13, 2006September 27, 2010The building is constructed of masonry, with a steel frame, and metal cladding. The building currently contains a total of 3,862 windows on its facades. Inside, there are four banks of 8 elevators designed by theOtis Elevator CompanyOtis Elevator Corporation.The building was declared aNational Historic Landmarkin 1976,Cite documenthttp://pdfhost.focus.nps.gov/docs/NHLS/Text/76001237.pdfPDFNational Register of Historic Places Inventory-Nomination: Chrysler BuildingCarolynPittsAugust 1976National Park ServiceMay 3, 2009andPDFlink[http://pdfhost.focus.nps.gov/docs/NHLS/Photos/76001237.pdf ''Accompanying 1 photo, exterior, undated'']164 KBand aNew York City Landmarkin 1978.

The Chrysler Building is also renowned and recognized for its terraced crown. Composed of seven radiating terraced arches, Van Alen's design of the crown is a cruciformgroin vaultconstructed into seven concentric members with transitioning setbacks, mounted up one behind another.cite webhttp://www.thecityreview.com/chryslerb.htmlThe City Review.com – Chrysler Building by AIA Carter B. HorsleyThecityreview.comSeptember 27, 2010The stainless-steel cladding is ribbed and riveted in a radiatingsunburstpattern with many triangular vaulted windows, transitioning into smaller segments of the seven narrow setbacks of the facade of the terraced crown. The entire crown is clad with silvery "Enduro KA-2" metal, anausteniticstainless steeldeveloped in Germany byKruppand marketed under thetrade name"Nirosta" (a Germanacronymforni'chtrostenderSta'hl, meaning "non-rusting steel").cite webhttp://www.bssa.org.uk/topics.php?articleArticle: Trade names associated with stainless steelsBssa.org.ukSeptember 27, 2010

When the building first opened, it contained a publicObservation deckviewing galleryon the 71st floor, which was closed to the public in 1945. This floor is now the highest occupied floor of the Chrysler Building, it was occupied by an office space management firm in 1986.cite webMichaelisDavidhttp://www.mrbellersneighborhood.com/story.php?storyidhttp://web.archive.org/web/20090519083624/http://www.mrbellersneighborhood.com/story.php?storyidMay 19, 2009Inside the Needle: The Chrysler Building Gets Lit by David MichaelisMrBellersNeighborhoodMarch 31, 2002September 27, 2010The privateCloud Cluboccupied a three-floor high space from the 66th68th floors, but closed in the late 1970s. Above the 71st floor, the stories of the building are designed mostly for exterior appearance, functioning mainly as landings for the stairway to the spire. These top stories are very narrow with low, sloped ceilings, and are useful only for holding radio-broadcasting and other mechanical and electrical equipment.Television stationWCBS-TV(Channel 2) originally transmitted from the top of the Chrysler in the 1940s and early 1950s, before moving to the Empire State Building.For many years,WPAT-FMandWKTUWTFM (now WKTU)also used the Chrysler Building as a transmission site, but they also moved to the Empire State Building by the 1970s. There are currently no commercial broadcast stations located at the Chrysler Building.

There are two sets of lighting in the top spires and decoration. The first are the V-shaped lighting inserts in the steel of the building itself. Added later were groups of floodlights that are on mast arms directed back at the building. This allows the top of the building to be lit in many colors for special occasions. This lighting was installed by electrician Charles Londner and crew during construction.
article.heading: Representation
article.paragraph: The Chrysler Building has been shown in several movies that take place in New York. In the summer of 2005, New York's ownSkyscraper Museumasked one hundred architects, builders, critics, engineers, historians, and scholars, among others, to choose their 10 favorites among 25 New York towers. The Chrysler Building came in first place as 90% of them placed the building in their top-10 favorite buildings.cite newsIn a City of Skyscrapers, Which Is the Mightiest of the High? Experts Say It's No ContestDavid W.Dunlaphttp://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?resThe New York TimesSeptember 1, 2005April 8, 2008

The Chrysler Building's distinctive profile has inspired similar skyscrapers worldwide, includingOne Liberty PlaceinPhiladelphia.cite newsGoldbergerPaulhttp://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?resGiving New Life to Philadelphia's Skylineparagraph 6, line 4The tower resembles nothing so much as the Chrysler Building...The New York TimesNovember 15, 1987September 27, 2010University of WisconsinMadison; School of Engineering One Liberty Place; Slide 18, Building Materialswaybackhttp://ecow.engr.wisc.edu/cgi-bin/getbig/cee/340/davidcamac/studentsbu/onelibertyplacepresentation.ppt20150504050158
